Issues.Title: fix(compiler-cli): handle inline type-check blocks in nullish coalescing extended check
Issues.Body:
This commit fixes an inconsistency where a type check location for an inline
type check block would be interpreted to occur in a type-checking shim instead.
This resulted in a missing template mapping, causing a crash due to an unsafe
non-null assertion operator.

In the prior commit the `TcbLocation` has been extended with an `isShimFile`
field that is now being used to look for the template mapping in the correct
location. Additionally, the non-null assertion operator is refactored such
that a missing template mapping will now ignore the warning instead of crashing
the compiler.

Fixes #45413

Issues.Title: Add support for getting translation based on external id
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

localize

### Description

Angular has a $localize feature that seems to be used only at built time and there is no way to get an actual translation at runtime using a dynamic generated id in a TypeScript file. Use case would be a backend call that returns translation ids that are used to get the Angular i18n translation and display that translated message in the UI.



### Proposed solution

- Create a basic service LocalizeService that has a single method  
`get(id:string):string` that returns the exact translated message of the current selected locale.

- Create a more advanced version that takes in all the features $localize would do but then at runtime like parameters etc...

### Alternatives considered

We are using Angular localise feature so there is no alternative to use. This should be a basic feature in Angular.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add support for getting translation based on external id" (#45467)

Issues.Title: extract-i18n JSON format add support for meaning and description
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

localize

### Description

The command `ng extract-i18n --format=json` works fine and generates a JSON with all the translations included, but they are missing the `:meaning|description:` part, which is available in the default XLIFF format (haven't checked the others).
The source strings:
```
$localize `:something|direction:Right`
$localize `:correct:Right`
$localize `Text 1`
$localize `Text 2`
...
```

The generated JSON:
```
{
  "locale": "en-US",
  "translations": {
    "7732309408488818531": "Right",
    "6238291467288576076": "Right",
    "7186168002821041410": "Text 1",
    "7402672269023827698": "Text 2",
    ...
}
```

### Proposed solution

Supporting both the single string value and an object with the value and the meaning/description, like this:
```
{
  "locale": "en-US",
  "translations": {
    "7732309408488818531": {
      "target": "Right",
      "meaning": "something",
      "description": "direction"
    },
    "6238291467288576076": {
      "target": "Right",
      "description": "correct"
    },
    "7186168002821041410": "Text 1",
    "7402672269023827698": "Text 2",
    ...
}
```
`meaning` and `description` would be completely optional, and could be deleted leaving only `target` if needed by the translators.

### Alternatives considered

none
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "extract-i18n JSON format add support for meaning and description" (#45465)

Issues.Title: ViewEncapsulation behavior changes based the elements rendered on AppComponent
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

core

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

Not sure if this is a regression.

I am following the [ViewEncapsulation documentation](https://angular.io/guide/view-encapsulation) with a local `ng new` project and I don't see the correct behavior (as said in the docs) when I render `<app-shadow-dom-encapsulation></app-shadow-dom-encapsulation>` on my `AppComponent` template.

I looked at the [linked stackblitz](https://stackblitz.com/run?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.component.ts) in the example and it works there.

The difference that I found was I only render the `app-shadow-dom-encapsulation` while the Stackblitz renders ALL 3 `app-no-encapsulation`, `app-emulated-encapsulation`, and `app-shadow-dom-encapsulation`.

Try removing `app-no-encapsulation` from the Stackblitz will result in unexpected behavior.

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://stackblitz.com/run?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.component.ts

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
Component styles with `ViewEncapsulation.None` inside of a Component with `ViewEncapsulation.ShadowDom` take precedence over the `ShadowDom`'s styles which is **not** the behavior mentioned in the docs.
```


### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true

Node: 14.18.2
Package Manager: npm 6.14.15
OS: darwin x64
```

Issues.Title: fix(zone.js): do not silence uncaught promise rejections when the `finally` is called
Issues.Body:
The native promise implementation logs unhandled promise rejections after `onFinally`
has been called. We may rely on the `scheduledByFinally` argument, which is `false` by
default, to avoid creating a breaking change; this will also allow us to reduce the number of
changes. The `finally` function should not silence unhandled promise rejections, because
they're not silenced in any implementation. If the `scheduleResolveOrReject` is called within
the `finally` we won't clear unhandled rejections. We'll keep the same behaviour if the
`scheduleResolveOrReject` is called within the `then`.

Issues.Body:

These changes add an annotation to prevent function inlining of the specific instruction.

Issues.Title: build: disable payload size uploading within bazel
Issues.Body:
Uploading payload size is unreliable from within Bazel. This is
because tests might not run for every commit, tests might have
been cached from a pull request RBE-build (causing payload uploading
to be skipped most of the time as every change comes from a PR)

We should disable the uploading as this is a fundamental problem
(good thing to note now) that we can solve with better payload
size tracking that we want to establish as part of dev-infra

More details on why this is relevant now. Renovate PRs have problems with uploading from Bazel -- and it's not worth putting effort into this anyway now: https://github.com/angular/angular/commit/1177b4e2f85d052aafc6e2ff173f07033878ddcd
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: disable payload size uploading within bazel" (#45446)

Issues.Title: fix(zone.js): do not run stack formatting when the lazy stack frames policy is used
Issues.Body:
We don't have to read the `stack` property when the lazy stack frames policy is used.
The V8 triggers the stack trace serialization only when the `stack` property is read for
the first time within the `Accessors::ErrorStackGetter`. We want to avoid formatting the stack
trace when the lazy policy is used, and we don't need the stack until the `zoneAwareStack`
property is read.

Issues.Title: ci: make payload size tracking script work with CircleCI and Bazel limitations
Issues.Body:
For quite some time now, since we started to use Bazel for integration tests, we
relied on some size tracking logic that did not actually fully work under Bazel.

It was thought that all the necessary CI push/PR information is available to the
Bazel test, but that was not the case. This was now fixed with the recent Rules NodeJS
v5 update where I made sure the `env.sh` variables are actually available before we
write them to the temporary file for the Bazel-access.

This now will unveil an issue because payload size goldens would start being based
on their branch name. e.g. the golden key in `13.3.x` should not be `master` but
`13.3.x`. This makes more sense than `master` as key, but makes things more
cumbersome and ideally we would not store the branch name at all (this is a larger
change though -- not worth now since we might refactor this anyway -- the payload limits
are always based on the currently checked-out branch/revision). For now we will
update the size tracking logic to always use `master` as golden key (like it worked
in the past year(s))

With the environment fix we now (again) start uploading payload size results to Firebase.
This did not work by accident either. The uploading logic is reliant on the CircleCI
commit range which is not working/reliable in upstream branches. This commit
removes this reliance on `COMMIT_RANGE` since it's not strictly necessary and
currently breaking renovate PRs. We can re-enable this when we have a solution with
CircleCI, or a workaround/resolution logic provided in e.g. `ng-dev ci determine-commit-range`.

(Internal discussion for later reference: https://angular-team.slack.com/archives/C029MM6RS4B/p1648240555186009)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "ci: make payload size tracking script work with CircleCI and Bazel limitations" (#45444)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular/cli): remove analytics prompt postinstall script
Issues.Body:
With this change we remove the postinstall hook that was used to prompt users to confirm if they'd like to share anonymous usage with the Angular team.

This post install hook was used to set the global configuration, which was mainly used for commands that run outside of a workspace such as `ng new`, `ng version` and ng `config`. We now prompt once the users runs the above mentioned commands instead of the post install.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular/cli): remove analytics prompt postinstall script" (#22909)

Issues.Title: refactor(@angular-devkit/core): deprecate unused exception classes
Issues.Body:
With this change we deprecate exception classes that are not used in the CLI repo.

DEPRECATED:

- `ContentHasMutatedException`, `InvalidUpdateRecordException`, `UnimplementedException` and `MergeConflictException` symbol from `@angular-devkit/core` have been deprecated in favor of the  symbol from `@angular-devkit/schematics`.
- `UnsupportedPlatformException` - A custom error exception should be created instead.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(@angular-devkit/core): deprecate unused exception classes" (#22910)

Issues.Title: build: fix node module repository symlinking disabled in Bazel
Issues.Body:
With the rules nodejs v5 update, the symlinking default has changed
from `true` to `false`. This commit explicitly adds the property and
sets it to `true` similar to other Angular repositories.

This helps speeding up the local DX by not having to maintain a
second node modules directory.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: fix node module repository symlinking disabled in Bazel" (#22908)

Issues.Title: An unhandled exception occurred: Dev-server address info is not defined
Issues.Body:
- [ x] serve ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: 12 When trying to run the application I get this error message: Running "ng:serve" (ng) task >>> Using Angular CLI => "ng serve" Warning: Running a server with --disable-host-check is a security risk. See https://medium.com/webpack/webpack-dev-server-middleware-security-issues-1489d950874a for more information. ⠋ Generating browser application bundles (phase: setup)...An unhandled exception occurred: Dev-server address info is not defined. See "/private/var/folders/62/m5vqsbd1251d77334_xl_4x40000gp/T/ng-G32x8J/angular-errors.log" for further details. ⠙ Generating browser application bundles (phase: setup)...Warning: Task "ng:serve" failed. Use --force to continue. The error is caused by this code in webpack.cli.js: ``` devServer.setupMiddlewares = (middlewares, devServer) => { if (!devServer) { throw new Error('webpack-dev-server is not defined'); } devServer.app.get('/', function (req, res, next) { res.set({ 'Content-Security-Policy': props.devServer.csp }); next(); }); }; ``` I used devServer.before before upgrading from Angular 12 to 13. The error from the mentioned angular-errors.log: ``` [error] Error: Dev-server address info is not defined. at xyz/node_modules/@angular-devkit/build-webpack/src/webpack-dev-server/index.js:63:27 ``` which relates to this code snippet from @angular-devkit/build-webpack/src/webpack-dev-server/index.js ``` const address = (_a = devServer.server) === null || _a === void 0 ? void 0 : _a.address(); if (!address) { obs.error(new Error(`Dev-server address info is not defined.`)); return; } ``` So it seems that devServer.server is not defined. I debugged it with this command: `node --inspect-brk node_modules/.bin/ng serve` And I could see that the server property is not directly on the devServer object, instead it's nested one level deeper in an options object: ``` devServer = { options: { server: ... } } ``` ## 🔥 Exception or Error 

An unhandled exception occurred: Dev-server address info is not defined.
## 🌍 Your Environment 


Angular CLI: 13.3.0
Node: 14.18.2
Package Manager: yarn 1.22.17
OS: darwin x64

Angular: 13.3.0
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, upgrade

Issues.Title: Output files' filename hashes are incorrect (reopening #22602)
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] extract-i18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: Angular 11 (per original bug report, I did not test this) ### Description Reopening #22602 If I understand correctly, per https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#1322-2022-02-02, this should be fixed in 13.2.2 and higher (since the main PR [#22612] associated with [ff54b49e7](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/commit/ff54b49e7097cda2eb835bc8c9674f71fcc91c3c) closed #22602 ) . However, I see the issue in 13.2.2, 13.3.0, and 14.0.0-next.6. ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction (copied from original bug, except for updated clone link to a fork with 13.3.0) 1. Clone https://github.com/JoshuaEN/angular-filename-hashing-bug-reproduction 1. Run `npm ci` to install dependencies. 1. Run `ng build --configuration=production` (with the default es2017 target in tsconfig.json). 1. Observe the contents of the output `dist/angular-filename-hashing-bug-reproduction/scripts.{revhash_1}.js` file to be `try{console.log()}catch(c){}`. 1. Change the `compilerOptions.target` to `es2019` (or `es2020` or `es2021`) from `es2017` in tsconfig.json. 1. Run `ng build --configuration=production`. 1. Observe the contents of the output `dist/angular-filename-hashing-bug-reproduction/scripts.{revhash_2}.js` file to be `try{console.log()}catch{}` (different from the output from step 4). 1. Observe that revhash_1 equals revhash_2. ## 🌍 Your Environment

    / \   _ __   __ _ _   _| | __ _ _ __     / ___| |   |_ _|
   / △ \ | '_ \ / _` | | | | |/ _` | '__|   | |   | |    | |
  / ___ \| | | | (_| | |_| | | (_| | |      | |___| |___ | |
 /_/   \_\_| |_|\__, |\__,_|_|\__,_|_|       \____|_____|___|
                |___/

### [`v14.0.0-next.8`](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/blob/HEAD/CHANGELOG.md#​1400-next8-2022-03-25)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/compare/14.0.0-next.7...14.0.0-next.8)

#### Breaking Changes

##### core

-   TypeScript versions older than 4.6 are no longer supported.

##### zone.js

-   in TaskTrackingZoneSpec track a periodic task until it is cancelled

The breaking change is scoped only to the plugin
`zone.js/plugins/task-tracking`. If you used `TaskTrackingZoneSpec` and
checked the pending macroTasks e.g. using `(this.ngZone as any)._inner
._parent._properties.TaskTrackingZone.getTasksFor('macroTask')`, then
its behavior slightly changed for periodic macrotasks. For example,
previously the `setInterval` macrotask was no longer tracked after its
callback was executed for the first time. Now it's tracked until
the task is explicitly cancelled, e.g  with `clearInterval(id)`.

fixes 45350

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>evanw/esbuild</summary>

### [`v0.14.28`](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/blob/HEAD/CHANGELOG.md#​01428)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/compare/v0.14.27...v0.14.28)

-   Add support for some new CSS rules ([#​2115](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/issues/2115), [#​2116](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/issues/2116), [#​2117](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/issues/2117))

    This release adds support for [`@font-palette-values`](https://drafts.csswg.org/css-fonts-4/#font-palette-values), [`@counter-style`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/@​counter-style), and [`@font-feature-values`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/@​font-feature-values). This means esbuild will now pretty-print and minify these rules better since it now better understands the internal structure of these rules:

    ```css
    /* Original code */
    @​font-palette-values Foo { base-palette: 1; }
    @​counter-style bar { symbols: b a r; }
    @​font-feature-values Bop { @​styleset { test: 1; } }

    /* Old output (with --minify) */
    @​font-palette-values Foo{base-palette: 1;}@​counter-style bar{symbols: b a r;}@​font-feature-values Bop{@​styleset {test: 1;}}

    /* New output (with --minify) */
    @​font-palette-values Foo{base-palette:1}@​counter-style bar{symbols:b a r}@​font-feature-values Bop{@​styleset{test:1}}
    ```

-   Upgrade to Go 1.18.0 ([#​2105](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/issues/2105))

    Binary executables for this version are now published with Go version 1.18.0. The [Go release notes](https://go.dev/doc/go1.18) say that the linker generates smaller binaries and that on 64-bit ARM chips, compiled binaries run around 10% faster. On an M1 MacBook Pro, esbuild's benchmark runs approximately 8% faster than before and the binary executable is approximately 4% smaller than before.

    This also fixes a regression from version 0.14.26 of esbuild where the browser builds of the `esbuild-wasm` package could fail to be bundled due to the use of built-in node libraries. The primary WebAssembly shim for Go 1.18.0 no longer uses built-in node libraries.

</details>

<summary>eslint/eslint</summary>

Issues.Title: refactor(@angular/cli): create package manager util class
Issues.Body:
Apart from better code quality, this helps reduce the time of CLI bootstrapping time, as retrieving the package manager name is a rather expensive operator due to the number of process spawns.

The package manager name isn't always needed until we run a command and therefore in some cases we can see an improvement of around `~600ms`. Ex: `ng b --help`. From ` 1.34s` to `0.76s`.

This will be important when we eventually introduce auto complete as users will get faster loopback.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(@angular/cli): create package manager util class" (#22893)

Issues.Title: Add legacyPeerDeps option to NodePackageInstallTask
Issues.Body:
<!--🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅

Oh hi there! 😄

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅-->

# 🚀 Feature request

### Description

Right now there is an opportunity to use `NodePackageInstallTask` when authoring schematics. This works well but there are cases when running simple `npm install` is not enough. For example, last version of NPM might throw "Unable to resolve dependency tree" error. This can be easily fixed with an `--legacy-peer-deps` option. Unfortunately, this option is not available for `NodePackageInstallTask`.

### Describe the solution you'd like

Add ability to provide `legacyPeerDeps` option to `NodePackageInstallTask`. Even better solution would be to add opportunity to provide any custom options to `NodePackageInstallTask`. They should be passed down to command line automatically.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

I've tried to write my own `NodePackageInstallTask` with an extra option. But this didn't work. I've discovered that provided options are just meta-data for the executor (https://github.dev/angular/angular-cli/blob/366cabc66c3dd836e2fdfea8dad6c4c7c2096b1d/packages/angular_devkit/schematics/tasks/package-manager/executor.ts#L112). From executor code it is clear that there is a predefined set of options for NPM task and there is no way to override or extend this.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add legacyPeerDeps option to NodePackageInstallTask" (#22886)

Issues.Body:
<!--🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅

Oh hi there! 😄

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.

# 🚀 Feature request

### Command (mark with an `x`)

<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ✍️edit: -->

- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [x] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] extract-i18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc

### Description

When generating libraries, there is neither an interactive input or a flag like `--style` for us to specify the stylesheet language. We have to manually edit the `angular.json` file to use other stylesheet languages:

```json
"projectType": "library",
"schematics": {
  "@schematics/angular:component": { "style": "less" }
},
```

### Describe the solution you'd like

A interactive input or a flag would be ncie

```sh
ng g lib some-lib --style=less
```

### Describe alternatives you've considered

As said before: manually edit the `angular.json` file.

```json
"schematics": {
  "@schematics/angular:component": { "style": "less" }
},
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Support specifying the stylesheet language when generating libraries" (#22884)

Issues.Title: docs-bug(Icon): Providing additional information to search icons at https://fonts.google.com/icons and being a bit clearer on how to use the different styles (Outlined, Two Tone, etc.)
Issues.Body:
### Documentation Feedback

I've used Angular + Angular Material for a few years now and only this year did I realize you can search for Material Icons at https://fonts.google.com/icons. This has made my life MUCH easier because the team at Google Fonts did an amazing job with their search / UI / etc. Probably a different issue to request, but it would be nice if Google Fonts gave you the `<mat-icon>icon</mat-icon>` markup as one of the options, but I digress.

I'd love to see some documentation on the Icon component page that at least mentions this link to search for Material Icons since per the current docs: 
> By default, `<mat-icon>` expects the [Material icons font](http://google.github.io/material-design-icons/#icon-font-for-the-web). 

Also, it wasn't obvious how the Outlined vs Rounded vs Two Tone styles are applied to <mat-icon> but once I found the site and noticed a class name was necessary, it became clear. I think the documentation is lacking in this respect as well

Yes I know that the `<mat-icon>` supports other fonts, but if the "default" expectation is a material icon, it would be great to a section in the docs on how to properly use it.

For example, this issue could be closed with proper documentation: https://github.com/angular/components/issues/22845
Another related issue that was created due to inadequate documentation: https://github.com/angular/components/issues/11544


### Affected documentation page

https://material.angular.io/components/icon
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "docs-bug(Icon): Providing additional information to search icons at https://fonts.google.com/icons and being a bit clearer on how to use the different styles (Outlined, Two Tone, etc.)" (#24699)

Issues.Title: build: avoid duplication of mdc dependencies by generating `package.json`
Issues.Body:
As part of the Yarn PNP changes we moved from `peerDependencies` in the
experimental package to actual `dependencies` on all individual MDC
packages we rely on. This is necessary for Yarn PnP and conceptually
also makes the package more correct/safe.

This resulted in duplication of the MDC dependencies, making MDC
updates more complicated. We can avoid duplication by auto-inserting
the dependencies. That way we keep two places for the MDC deps:

* The project `package.json`
* `packages.bzl` for the Bazel analysis phase/Starlark.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "build: avoid duplication of mdc dependencies by generating `package.json`" (#24697)

Issues.Title: feat(ScrollDispatcher): Scroll sdk should use passive event listeners for scroll event
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

I found that Lighthouse test failed on "use passive event listeners" check.
Problem is in these lines https://github.com/angular/components/blob/460b25cad996447e6a48175265159d27bb33a133/src/cdk/scrolling/scroll-dispatcher.ts#L185
https://github.com/angular/components/blob/460b25cad996447e6a48175265159d27bb33a133/src/cdk/scrolling/scrollable.ts#L52
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/40790510/160629638-7e2e62ea-d309-4f77-aa1c-b812cfdeca52.png)

Using passive listeners will be better for app performance ( https://developer.chrome.com/blog/passive-event-listeners/ )
I think it should be changed to 
`fromEvent(window.document, 'scroll', { passive: true })` and 
`fromEvent(this.elementRef.nativeElement, 'scroll', { passive: true })`

I can create a PR for this if necessary. (Update: already created #24695)

### Use Case

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "feat(ScrollDispatcher): Scroll sdk should use passive event listeners for scroll event" (#24693)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-date-range-input): JAWS-E goes to the end-date field first
Issues.Body:
### What are you trying to do?

Hi,

I am using a mat-date-range-input and the client is using JAWS-E (Next Edit Box) to go from input-field to input-field.
JAWS-E however first goes to the end date and then to the start date.

Thanks&Regards,
Nelleke



### What troubleshooting steps have you tried?




As I thought I was going something wrong, I had asked a question about it on stackoverflow first.
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/71321140/using-mat-date-range-input-but-the-jaws-reader-first-reads-the-end-date-with-jaw

I got a very useful comment that stated that the issue is caused by the 'aria-owns'.
As this is generated by Angular I am unable to fix this myself.


### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Add a mat-date-range-input element in the component.
2. Use JAWS-E Next Edit Box to navigate.
3. JAWS will first read the end-date field instead of the start-date.

Issues.Title: bug(matTooltip): tooltip doesn't disappear when mouseleave the selector
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

12.2.13

### Description

When mouseleave the selector, the tooltip should disappear, it would, but, in the case that the mouse is **between the selector and the tooltip**, the tooltip won't disappear in the latest version

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create button with tooltip 
2. Mouse hover between the selector and the tooltip


### Expected Behavior

the tooltip disappears

### Actual Behavior

the tooltip didn't disappear

Issues.Title: bug(Mat-Form-Field): Angular Material form field Long label overlapping with input text

### Description


Angular material form field label overlaps with user entered text, Also long labels with fields have issue with responsiveness.

### Actual Behavior

Issues.Title: feat(mat-form-field): Optional remove mat-label space if not set.
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

**Form field with label**
```html
<mat-form-field>
  <mat-label>Label</mat-label>
  <input matInput>
</mat-form-field>
```
![default](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/60390085/160569245-c3b3aeaf-c491-45c4-90e2-4eaa9d451d41.png)

**Form field without label (actual)**
```html
<mat-form-field>
  <input matInput>
</mat-form-field>
```
![no-label](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/60390085/160569255-ebe0549f-f8ab-4c4b-993c-6b02950be12f.png)

**Form field without label (expected)**
```html
<mat-form-field>
  <input matInput>
</mat-form-field>
```
![expected](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/60390085/160569254-5f335468-1e9d-4ca7-9bda-efba6bf8d3ac.png)
(remove mat-label reserved space)
or
![expected2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/60390085/160570073-c08cae28-5ee3-450c-afb7-68cc0b6f01d1.png)
(center the value like the mat-label does)

We could add an optional attribute for `mat-form-field` like `label="none"` or something like this.

(all inputs are `appearance="fill"`, the new default, currently set in `MAT_FORM_FIELD_DEFAULT_OPTIONS`)



### Use Case

Using inputs on context without label required.

Due to different themes on GitHub, this is probably more visible:
![collage](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/60390085/160574270-5c0d4e3f-fca1-401a-b5a3-62ce7951e7be.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(mat-form-field): Optional remove mat-label space if not set." (#24688)

Issues.Title: bug(LiveAnnouncer): not resolving promises
Issues.Body:
### Description

Some LiveAnnouncer.announce('message') promises called more than once in sequence (with a delay < 100 ms) or in parallel are not resolved. 

### Reproduction
Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: 
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-xn9hkc 

Call LiveAnnouncer.announce('message') more than once in sequence (with a delay < 100 ms) or parallel. 

### Expected Behavior

All announce promises are either resolved or rejected.

### Actual Behavior

Only the last announce promise is resolved. All promises before are never resolved.

### Environment

- Angular: 13.3.0
- CDK/Material: 13.3.1
- Browser(s): Chrome Version 99.0.4844.51 
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(LiveAnnouncer): not resolving promises" (#24686)

Issues.Title: docs-bug(CHANGELOG): changelog does not document all breaking changes
Issues.Body:
### Documentation Feedback

Note: This is a documentation bug in the `changelog.md` file, not in `material.angular.io` itself.

I am currently upgrading one of my company's Angular applications from v11 to v12 and noticed that one of their internally published packages was depending upon an export (`'MAT_STEPPER_GLOBAL_OPTIONS'` from `'@angular/cdk/stepper'`). I assumed that this was a deprecation and went searching the changelog for notice of the deprecation so that I could be sure of what change needed to be made. Upon searching the changelog, I could not find a deprecation/breaking change related to this. However, I did find this PR, https://github.com/angular/components/pull/21901, which seems to describe the deprecation.

I know that you all utilize automation to generate your changelog, so I was confused as to how this had been missed. I think that it's because the commit message contains the text "BREAKING CHANGES:" rather than "BREAKING CHANGE:".

I wanted to make a note of this to see if you all would manually update the `changelog.md` file to include this as a breaking change and perhaps audit your PRs to see if anything else may have been accidentally missed in the past?

### Affected documentation page

https://github.com/angular/components/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "docs-bug(CHANGELOG): changelog does not document all breaking changes" (#24684)

Addresses #11127

Issues.Title: Angular Material tooltip bug
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

11.2.13

### Description

Hello,

I found a bug in the newest version of angular material. If you hover fastly over a component (e.g. a button) which has a tooltip with a delay in it, it's nevertheless flashing and showing up the tooltip instantly for a moment and then it disappears again.

Here is my HTML:

<button [matTooltip]="'Test'" [matTooltipShowDelay]='1000'>Test </button> 

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create button with tooltip and a delay 
2. Hover fastly over the button


### Expected Behavior

Tooltip shouldn't appear, only after one second

### Actual Behavior

Tooltip appears, altough one second didn't passed

### Environment

- Angular: Current
- CDK/Material: Current
- Browser(s): Chrome/Firefox
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Angular Material tooltip bug" (#24681)
